Notes.Text:
This update for SuSEfirewall2 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-15638: Fixed a security issue with too open implicit portmapper rules
  (bsc#1064127): A source net restriction for _rpc_ services
  was not taken into account for the implicitly added rules for port 111,
  making the portmap service accessible to everyone in the affected zone.

This update was imported from the SUSE:SLE-12:Update and SUSE:SLE-12-SP3:Update update projects.
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: The SuSEfirewall2 package before 3.6.312-2.13.1 in SUSE Linux Enterprise (SLE) Desktop 12 SP2, Server 12 SP2, and Server for Raspberry Pi 12 SP2; before 3.6.312.333-3.10.1 in SLE Desktop 12 SP3 and Server 12 SP3; before 3.6_SVNr208-2.18.3.1 in SLE Server 11 SP4; before 3.6.312-5.9.1 in openSUSE Leap 42.2; and before 3.6.312.333-7.1 in openSUSE Leap 42.3 might allow remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions on the portmap service by leveraging a missing source net restriction for _rpc_ services.
